document.title: Kentucky Core Academic Standards - Arts and Humanities

3DD6D999F9CB4C149041E0659FA6064D.description: communicate common meaning through creating and performing in the four art forms

8D7BDDC765614EAE91266B8C054D172D.description: begin to identify commonalities between the arts and other subjects taught in the school (e.g., observation skills in visual arts and science, historical and cultural perspectives in the arts and social studies, shape in visual art and mathematics, dance and a healthy lifestyle, fractions in music notation and mathematics, reading music and reading words, composing music and writing)

40660457D74C4D4D9004480525137727.description: identify and explain connections between and among different art forms from the same culture or from the same time period

8705860CA3F54391AF859C0D16CAF8BB.description: begin to notice communication of common themes or ideas across different art forms

25A513A0266A425EBB3C6DE8C230622B.description: begin to recognize that common terms are used in various arts (e.g., tempo in dance and music)

70B896AFAAE64D30B2E8B5BEB71488E1.description: the modes of thinking and methods of the arts disciplines can be used to illuminate situations in other disciplines that require creative solutions.

FEBF6CA39C8F44AAA0D99C8D079DB338.description: the arts provide forms of non-verbal communication that can strengthen the presentation of ideas and emotions.

8ABCE1B9002E46AD87D8D9FEFDF56209.description: music, dance, drama and visual art created in common cultures and/or common historical periods tend to reflect common attitudes, ideas, beliefs, and feelings.

5E0D4ABE25AD4D409409524CD928ACEB.description: the arts are basic forms of human communication.

A88C5CDF70804EB99071E6179C194CED.description: describe personal responses to artwork; explain why there might be different responses to specific works of art

3397AD6D557B4EF6986D80B38C583492.description: demonstrate behavior appropriate for observing the particular context and style of visual arts being viewed; discuss opinions with peers in a supportive and constructive way

E16E455448434A28B1449067742C8704.description: identify possible criteria for evaluating visual arts (e.g., skill of artist, originality, emotional impact, variety, interest)

BAB5ECD38CD24AC5A865DB2784363342.description: begin to learn how to use knowledge of the elements and principles of art and art terminology to describe and critique their own work and the work of others

2A1592BB4F6A4C6496BC2BE19FBD7610.description: be actively involved in creating artworks

96F9267E6F47474F9CBAE4FA0965683E.description: demonstrate behavior appropriate for observing the particular context and style of dramatic works being performed; discuss opinions with peers in a supportive and constructive way

E3BF3CFECBC14AB8A221DA28BBAD3A36.description: identify possible criteria for evaluating dramatic works (e.g., skill of performers, originality, emotional impact, variety, interest)

0725AE189941436085E7D6658430A96F.description: begin to learn how to use knowledge of the elements of drama and drama terminology to describe and critique their own performances and the performances of others

13E90E3EA0824C29BAEEC11D8B92F669.description: be actively involved in creating and performing dramatic works

EA49D552A8E1447D9266BFEB64611438.description: demonstrate behavior appropriate for observing the particular context and style of dance being performed; discuss opinions with peers in a supportive and constructive way

1E0977B4881540278A997FFA3E56D251.description: identify possible criteria for evaluating dance (e.g., skill of performers, originality, emotional impact, variety, interest)

1768F360E09C455A9EA87F0043357108.description: begin to learn how to use knowledge of the elements of dance and dance terminology to describe and critique their own performances and the performances of others

71C44196E1994E2AADF44EB670BDEC04.description: be actively involved in creating and performing dance alone and with others

CA97154DF0C741A88A049DC442730788.description: demonstrate behavior appropriate for observing the particular context and style of music being performed; discuss opinions with peers in a supportive and constructive way

38F7F2AD14DA4E0188F323F96F4D29DA.description: identify possible criteria for evaluating music (e.g., skill of performers, originality, emotional impact, variety, interest)

FBF3745FD3EF42F287FF1491E15AC3A9.description: begin to learn how to use knowledge of the elements of music and music terminology to describe and critique their own performances and the performances of others

2BCB3ED05B3C423A927BAE7550AEEB86.description: be actively involved in creating and performing music alone and with others

3257771ECD574DD69B29EC63529740E2.description: existing and emerging technologies can extend the reach of the art form to new audiences.

DA79D6C28BE74D3CA0DD40510A56C35D.description: openness, respect for work and an understanding of how artists apply elements and principles of design in creating and performing are personal attitudes and skills that enhance enjoyment of the observer.

2FC3F2DA13B841E69EE2629BB50E4AC0.description: full understanding and appreciation of the arts requires some degree of involvement in all three processes.

D5C3A3FD3869421381924C0ED1EB2B4D.description: there are three distinct processes for involvement in the arts; creating new artworks, performing works previously created and responding to artworks and performances.

6528CD14A966475A82E2BF29FCA0637C.description: create new and experience artworks designed to fulfill a variety of specific purposes

D5D15D4A51C74B2FB154256113B8B21D.description: begin to develop an awareness of the purposes for which artworks are created (e.g., ceremonial, artistic expression, narrative, functional)

181E374F3E2A43BCBDC9CD5373773A6C.description: observe and perform dramatic works created to fulfill a variety of specific purposes

0D95D9025027446A9ACD173AA56C1276.description: begin to develop an awareness of the purposes for which dramatic works are created (e.g., sharing the human experience, passing on tradition and culture, recreational, artistic expression)

658DF1BC8ADB4EE49DE12EB9DB984C11.description: observe and perform dance created to fulfill a variety of specific purposes

C7A6169D1CAA4999B804E6BAD540741A.description: begin to develop an awareness of the purposes for which dance is created (e.g., ceremonial, recreational, artistic expression)

B44095587D1847B29CDD00DCD612724E.description: listen to and perform music created to fulfill a variety of specific purposes

79C8B081B22246798B48772C1C53EE60.description: begin to develop an awareness of the purposes for which music is created (e.g., ceremonial, recreational, artistic expression)

0C7F0F4DF10A43EE9CB5DC1E5D370FB0.description: the arts provide forms of nonverbal communication that can strengthen the presentation of ideas and emotions.

8630F91B244741E4BCB5EDC3D4A57863.description: the arts have value and significance for daily life. They provide personal fulfillment, whether in career settings, a vocational pursuit, or leisure.

2797C351F7074EF093D40F3181E8F60F.description: the arts fulfill a variety of purposes in society (e.g., to present issues and ideas, to entertain, to teach or persuade, to design, plan and beautify).

004DF27AF9C44719AE933DF5A0D16040.description: begin to describe artworks of specific cultures using visual art terminology

97BFE0FC350143A986082E8A225B7FD6.description: begin to associate artworks they experience or create with the Colonial American period in history; describe in simple terms how the art of the American Colonies reflects the Colonial American time period

8064465C92714495A3F3E16F0C5ED76C.description: begin to associate artworks they experience or create with specific cultures (Native American, Appalachian, West African); describe in simple terms how the art of these cultures reflects the cultures

E14891E4FAA048998DF541EF5466AA21.description: begin to describe folktales, legends, or myths of specific cultures using drama/theatre terminology

EC30C76F002F44EAB5064B72B8E413F8.description: begin to associate folktales, legends, or myths they experience or perform with the Colonial American period in history; describe in simple terms how literature and oral tradition reflect the Colonial American time period

B91B78BC4ABD40A4839AC0D96D977247.description: begin to associate folktales, legends, or myths they experience or perform with specific cultures (Native American, Appalachian, West African); describe in simple terms how literature and oral tradition reflect the cultures

2AC746CF08794BFE885002F0B794A72D.description: begin to describe the dance of specific cultures using dance terminology

287013AA38CD4EF8B4DF9D95736652CD.description: begin to associate dances they observe or perform with the Colonial American period in history; describe in simple terms how dances reflect the Colonial American time period

3B1F1A56EB7D4D37AA9510D9C558A14D.description: begin to associate dances they observe or perform with specific cultures (Native American, Appalachian, West African); describe in simple terms how dances reflect the cultures

41708B369FD6435ABCE7ACFED55D31DD.description: begin to describe the music of specific cultures using music terminology

8DFC1D03CC444624BF3523CDF018E366.description: begin to associate music they listen to or perform with the Colonial American period in history; describe in simple terms how the music reflects the Colonial American time period

8E1755D3F08D42A284530B2E80D6E3D4.description: begin to associate music they listen to or perform with specific cultures (Native American, Appalachian, West African); describe in simple terms how the music reflects the cultures

0914586C74DE4636B6E36D9670F41892.description: the arts play a major role in the creation and defining of cultures and building civilizations.

F662F3C4523A4E62910143BFEA9868B5.description: the arts help us understand others' (often very different) ways of thinking, working, and expressing ourselves.

D1607A9D76A348F9BEECDD06D438C575.description: the arts are powerful tools for understanding human experiences both past and present.

1005CA511CBF45B4AF60BE5225283701.description: explore, describe and compare elements of art (e.g., line, shape, form, texture, primary and secondary colors, color schemes) and principles of design (e.g., focal point, pattern, balance, contrast) in two and three dimensional artworks

10AC0EE2F7E1468893723EC263F4CEE8.description: use the elements of art and principles of design in creating artworks independently and with others

97689F1A40B44869A0E1D88AB5DA0A92.description: begin to recognize and identify elements of art (line, shape, form, texture, color) and principles of design (emphasis, pattern, balance, contrast) using visual art terminology

A1127D25A0664B1EA7133B6AB31E3263.description: explore a variety of dramatic works (e.g., theater, dramatic media - film, television)

33ED70B6FA2643A3B4BA83E22DD754DD.description: observe, describe and apply creative dramatics (improvisation, mimicry, pantomime, role playing and story telling) in a variety of situations

1B4DC237252D49AA9884FB621E8F2B84.description: use the elements of drama in creating and performing dramatic works independently and with others

F6DADBA43459433F9E19FBB70EB824A2.description: begin to recognize and identify elements of drama (literary, technical, performance) using drama/theatre terminology

C43E994083794185AD27693CC059A395.description: observe, describe and demonstrate locomotor (e.g. walk, run, skip, gallop) and nonlocomotor (e.g. bend, stretch, twist, swing) movements

92B1F450EB7F425BBBEB7508E788E361.description: use the elements of dance in creating, copying and performing patterns of movement independently and with others

BBD796F338F14C6AB81A05F8ABA3713C.description: begin to recognize and identify elements of dance (space, time, force) and basic dance forms using dance terminology

807C413494364FC191F5C52A0DB15DA9.description: recognize, describe and compare various styles of music (spirituals, game songs, folk songs, work songs, lullabies, patriotic, bluegrass)

37E6B8856D9141C4BB01FAC516829069.description: listen to and explore how changing elements results in different musical effects

02B12A964C654B01B71EB508932A9160.description: use the elements of music while performing, singing, playing instruments, moving, listening, reading music, writing music, and creating music independently and with others

48C2E002A972441E9F78CFD902C9D353.description: begin to recognize and identify elements of music (rhythm, tempo, melody, harmony, form, timbre, dynamics) using musical terminology

2F20B984A4FD467E871F7476D854138F.description: existing and emerging technologies can inspire new applications of structural components.

C1FA4A3E5AA84E409BA3B7ED0DF2BCA1.description: responding to or critiquing works of art involves an understanding of elements, principles and structures appropriate to each area of the arts.

73822DF907F44BB8A535F38858D81348.description: the elements and principles of design of visual art are intentionally applied in creating works of art.

7875157151A24C59A98AF257ADEA8873.description: the elements of music, dance, and drama are intentionally applied in creating and performing.
